qas.question: What genre of music featured robotic themes?
What is the Detroit Electronic Music Festival known as?

context: <a0_0>Detroit<a0_0/> is cited as the birthplace of techno music in the early 1980s. The city also lends its name to an early and pioneering genre of electronic dance music, "<a1_0>Detroit techno<a1_0/>". Featuring science fiction imagery and robotic themes, its futuristic style was greatly influenced by the geography of Detroit's urban decline and its industrial past. Prominent Detroit techno artists include Juan Atkins, Derrick May, and Kevin Saunderson. The Detroit Electronic Music Festival, now known as "<a2_0>Movement<a2_0/>", occurs annually in late May on <a3_0>Memorial Day Weekend<a3_0/>, and takes place in <a4_0>Hart Plaza<a4_0/>. In the early years (2000-2002), this was a landmark event, boasting over a million estimated attendees annually, coming from all over the world to celebrate Techno music in the city of its birth.
